TopicTitle: module = Propulsion (really meant category, not module)

Articles.Content:
So, this is depreciated, but still works: 

module = Propulsion

Exactly what happens with parts labeled with this, and I assume they should be changed to either Engines or FuelTanks?

Edited October 26, 2016 by linuxgurugamer

I think those are holdouts from when Parts used to be more specialized.

As far as I know everything (except perhaps struts?) should be using module = Part.

The long story is that line determines what Class is used for the Part (not the modules, but the actual Part).  This was the system before PartModules were created.  Originally each type of Part was ran by its own class.  You can see in the API/class definitons that there is an 'Engine' class (or maybe it was propulsion..), that was a subclass of part, and included all of the engine functionality.  Others existed for 'ladder', 'wing', and a few other types.

However this layout prevent a part from being both an 'engine' and a 'ladder' at the same time, as those functionalities were locked behind different sublcasses.  The move to PartModule allowed for much more generic use of the Part class and removed the need for it to be subclassed for most use cases.


TL:DR -- use 'module = Part' unless you are making a strut.  Other uses for that functionality have been completely deprecated as far as I'm aware.  There might be some use for it in a few modding scenarios, but I haven't found one that couldn't be accomplished through PartModules, and no idea if they will be stable in the future.
The things is that all those class are gone in 1.2...

On 10/22/2016 at 1:52 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

So, this is depreciated, but still works: 


module = Propulsion

Exactly what happens with parts labeled with this, and I assume they should be changed to either Engines or FuelTanks?

and of course, I really meant:  category

So, rephrasing my question:

So, this is depreciated, but still works: 

category = Propulsion

Exactly what happens with categories labeled with this, and I assume they should be changed to either Engines or FuelTanks?

2 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

and of course, I really meant:  category

So, rephrasing my question:

So, this is depreciated, but still works: 


category = Propulsion

Exactly what happens with categories labeled with this, and I assume they should be changed to either Engines or FuelTanks?

 

Yes, you should use either 'Engines' or 'FuelTanks', whichever is appropriate for that part.

16 minutes ago, Shadowmage said:

 

Yes, you should use either 'Engines' or 'FuelTanks', whichever is appropriate for that part.

I know, and have made those changes.  Yet some Squad parts still use "category = Propulsion", so I wonder what the Propulsion actually does.

8 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

I know, and have made those changes.  Yet some Squad parts still use "category = Propulsion", so I wonder what the Propulsion actually does.

 

Likely that stock has some back-end code that looks for that category and reassigns it to either Engines or Propulsion based on certain criteria.  Probably it looks for a ModuleEngines (or subclass) and calls those 'Engines', and defaults the others to 'FuelTanks'.

42 minutes ago, Shadowmage said:

Likely that stock has some back-end code that looks for that category and reassigns it to either Engines or Propulsion based on certain criteria.  Probably it looks for a ModuleEngines (or subclass) and calls those 'Engines', and defaults the others to 'FuelTanks'.

Makes sense, thanks

I still need to update KW, but SXT Continued is all updated
